decks.notes: The key concept of this deck revolves around using control tactics to disrupt the opponent's game plan and gain card advantage. The deck combines a mix of disruptive creatures like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Merfolk Windrobber with mill cards like Ruin Crab to slowly deplete the opponent's deck. Cards like Drown in the Loch and Heartless Act offer removal options, while counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Disdainful Stroke provide protection. The deck also utilizes cards like Into the Story and Of One Mind to draw additional cards and maintain a strong hand. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the game and outsmarting the opponent.

The key concept of the deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's plans and slowly whittling away at their resources. This is achieved through a combination of mill effects, such as Ruin Crab and Merfolk Windrobber, and disruptive spells like Didn't Say Please, Eliminate, and Disdainful Stroke. The deck also has a strong card advantage engine with Into the Story and Soaring Thought-Thief. Additionally, the deck includes a number of counterspells, removal spells, and flexible card draw options to maintain control of the game.

The focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of mill effects and disruption spells. By playing cards like Thieves' Guild Enforcer, Ruin Crab, and Into the Story, the goal is to mill out the opponent's deck while keeping the board under control with cards like Heartless Act and Drown in the Loch. Additionally, with Lurrus of the Dream-Den as the companion, players can reuse key cards from their graveyard to maintain their control over the game.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on utilizing mill effects and disruption to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By using cards like Ruin Crab, Soaring Thought-Thief, and Thieves' Guild Enforcer to mill the opponent's deck, combined with counterspells like Mystical Dispute and removal spells like Heartless Act, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and win through card advantage with Into the Story. Agadeem's Awakening provides a late-game recursion option, while Lurrus of the Dream-Den offers additional value by allowing certain permanents to be recurred from the graveyard.

The main idea of this deck is to mill the opponent's deck using cards like Ruin Crab and Thieves' Guild Enforcer while controlling the board with cards like Drown in the Loch and Heartless Act. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, generate card advantage with Into the Story, and protect its own creatures with Lurrus of the Dream-Den. Lullmage's Domination and Agadeem's Awakening can help turn the tide of the game in your favor. The strategy revolves around staying ahead on the board and in card advantage to outlast and outplay the opponent.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on milling the opponent's deck and disrupting their strategies with counterspells and removal spells. It utilizes cards like Merfolk Windrobber, Ruin Crab, Thieves' Guild Enforcer, Soaring Thought-Thief, and Drown in the Loch to mill the opponent's deck while using counterspells like Mystical Dispute and removal spells like Heartless Act and Eliminate to control the board. The deck also includes card draw spells like Into the Story and Of One Mind to maintain card advantage. Castle Locthwain provides additional card draw while the deck's mana base ensures consistency and flexibility.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing mill effects and disrupting the opponent's strategy. By using cards like Ruin Crab, Drown in the Loch, and Into the Story, the goal is to mill the opponent's deck while removing threats with cards like Heartless Act and Eliminate. Additionally, using cards like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Soaring Thought-Thief can further disrupt the opponent's game plan. The companion Lurrus of the Dream-Den adds an additional layer of consistency and value to the deck.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy by milling their deck with cards like Ruin Crab, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Drown in the Loch and Heartless Act. The deck aims to generate card advantage with Into the Story and maintain control of the game with counterspells like Mystical Dispute. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a companion to provide additional value by recurring creatures. The deck focuses on grinding out the opponent and out valuing them to secure a victory.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and mill effects. By controlling the board with cards like Drown in the Loch and Heartless Act, while also milling the opponent with Ruin Crab and Thieves' Guild Enforcer, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and win the game through card advantage. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing the player to recur their small creatures for extra advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy and preventing them from executing their game plan. This is achieved through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Ruin Crab. By using cards like Into the Story and Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent in the late game by drawing cards and recurring key threats. Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining control of the board and outlasting the opponent to secure victory.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan using a combination of mill (Ruin Crab, Merfolk Windrobber, Soaring Thought-Thief), cheap removal (Heartless Act, Eliminate), counterspells (Negate), and graveyard disruption (Cling to Dust). The deck focuses on controlling the board and hand, while building card advantage through cards like Into the Story. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by disrupting their game plan and grinding them out with a steady stream of threats and answers.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures. The key concept is to utilize efficient creature cards, such as Questing Beast, Bonecrusher Giant, and Lovestruck Beast, to deal damage quickly. The deck also includes supporting cards like Scavenging Ooze and Kazandu Mammoth for added versatility and resilience. Additionally, the deck benefits from powerful enchantments like Klothys, God of Destiny and The Great Henge to further enhance its aggression. The inclusion of Embercleave and Fire Prophecy spell cards provide additional removal and damage options. The deck also features a solid mana base with Fabled Passage and a mix of Mountains and Forests for consistent plays.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Questing Beast early on to apply pressure to the opponent. By utilizing cards like Lovestruck Beast and Edgewall Innkeeper, it aims to draw additional cards and maintain board presence. Goldspan Dragon and Embercleave provide additional win conditions by granting extra damage and evasion. The removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Fire Prophecy help deal with opposing threats, while The Akroan War can potentially steal an opponent's creature. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a combination of strong creatures and combat tricks.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence and applying pressure to the opponent with efficient creatures and powerful combat tricks. The deck aims to utilize cards like Bonecrusher Giant, Embercleave, and Questing Beast to deal damage quickly and overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like The Great Henge and Scavenging Ooze provide additional value and resilience to help maintain momentum in the mid to late game. The deck's strategy revolves around aggressive, proactive plays and leveraging the synergy between its creatures and combat tricks.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on putting early pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures like Lovestruck Beast, Bonecrusher Giant, and Brushfire Elemental. The deck also includes powerful finishers such as Goldspan Dragon and Questing Beast. It aims to utilize the synergy between creatures and cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Embercleave for maximum value. The deck includes a mix of removal spells like Spikefield Hazard and Fire Prophecy to deal with threats and disruption through cards like The Akroan War. The mana base ensures consistent access to all necessary colors for the deck's spells.

This deck revolves around the key mechanic of Gyruda, Doom of Depths. The goal is to use Gyruda's ability to mill the opponent's deck and put creatures with even converted mana costs onto the battlefield under your control. To support this strategy, the deck includes cards like Glass Casket and Heartless Act for removal, Binding the Old Gods for removal and ramp, and Wolfwillow Haven for additional ramp. The deck also includes cards like Thassa, Deep-Dwelling and Shepherd of the Cosmos to blink creatures and generate value.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly cycle through cards to trigger powerful effects such as Zenith Flare and Irencrag Pyromancer, while also putting pressure on the opponent with aggro creatures like Flourishing Fox and Valiant Rescuer. The focus is on utilizing the cycling mechanic to draw cards and deal damage efficiently, with a mix of control elements like Shredded Sails and Frostveil Ambush to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base is built to ensure smooth mana curve and hitting the necessary colors for spells.

The main theme of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures that benefit from cycling cards to trigger various effects. By constantly cycling cards, the player can quickly build up a strong board presence and finish off the opponent with Zenith Flare for massive damage. The deck also includes some control elements like Frostveil Ambush and Improbable Alliance to help deal with threats and maintain board advantage. The mana base is designed to provide the necessary colors for the spells while also ensuring consistent and efficient mana production.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly cycle through cards to trigger various effects and generate value, ultimately leading to a powerful Zenith Flare finisher. By utilizing cards like Rielle, the Everwise and Improbable Alliance, the deck aims to maintain card advantage and pressure the opponent with aggressive creatures like Drannith Stinger and Flourishing Fox. The deck also includes ways to protect its key creatures and draw additional cards to ensure consistency. Overall, the strategy revolves around cycling cards efficiently to overwhelm the opponent and secure victories.

The main concept of this Naya Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Lovestruck Beast, while also gaining card advantage with cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge. The deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures and utilize cards like Showdown of the Skalds to maintain momentum. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure smooth mana progression and maximize the potential of the deck's aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on building a strong and aggressive board presence with Naya-colored creatures and using powerful spells to maintain pressure on the opponent. By utilizing creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Lovestruck Beast, and Clarion Spirit, along with the card advantage provided by Edgewall Innkeeper and Felidar Retreat, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly. With the help of Showdown of the Skalds and Shepherd of the Flock, the deck can generate additional value and maintain tempo throughout the game while utilizing the specific abilities of each card to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using aggressive red creatures and spells. With an emphasis on fast-paced gameplay and powerful creatures like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Anax, Hardened in the Forge, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. With key cards like Embercleave and Frost Bite to deal additional damage, it capitalizes on the aggressive nature of the red color to secure a swift victory. Castle Embereth and Faceless Haven provide additional support for the deck's game plan.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on utilizing a high amount of removal and card advantage to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of counterspells, removal spells, ramp spells, and powerful threats, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and win through incremental advantage. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in the long game. By efficiently managing resources and making calculated decisions, this deck seeks to outlast and outplay opponents in a grindy game of attrition.

The main concept of the deck is to utilize control elements and a variety of powerful spells to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent. The deck incorporates a mix of removal spells like Eliminate and Heartless Act, card draw and selection options like Mazemind Tome and Omen of the Sea, and board wipes like Shadows' Verdict and Extinction Event. It also includes strong late-game threats such as Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Emergent Ultimatum to close out the game. The deck aims to control the game state and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful spells and creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain control of the game and outvalue the opponent through cards like Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider, Emergent Ultimatum, and Alrund's Epiphany. The deck also utilizes powerful removal spells like Heartless Act and Eliminate to deal with opposing threats. Additionally, the deck has access to powerful ramp spells like Cultivate and Wolfwillow Haven to ensure it can play its high impact spells ahead of schedule. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows the deck to generate additional value by flickering its permanents.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counter magic, and versatile threats. By utilizing powerful control elements like Mystical Dispute and Shadows' Verdict, alongside powerful threats like Vorinclex and Emergent Ultimatum, the deck aims to out value and outlast opponents in longer games. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as an additional value engine, providing extra card advantage and flexibility. The deck also includes ramp elements like Cultivate and Wolfwillow Haven to ensure it can reach its late-game power plays as quickly as possible.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using cards that disrupt the opponent's plans while generating card advantage and ramping into powerful late-game threats. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion, allowing for additional value from blinking permanents. The deck includes a mix of removal spells, counterspells, and board wipes to handle a variety of threats. The deck also includes powerful cards like Emergent Ultimatum and Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider to close out the game quickly once control has been established. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's three-color identity.

This deck focuses on controlling the board and out-valuing the opponent through card advantage and powerful threats. It utilizes a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and versatile cards like Emergent Ultimatum to help stabilize the game and pull ahead. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion provides additional value by blinking permanents for card advantage. The deck also includes a variety of lands to ensure consistent mana production. Overall, the key concept of this Sultai Control deck is to grind out the opponent and win through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while ramping up mana with Cultivate and Emergent Ultimatum to cast powerful spells like Alrund's Epiphany and Elspeth's Nightmare. Additionally, the deck includes a variety of removal spells such as Heartless Act and Shadows' Verdict to deal with threats on the board. The synergies between the cards in the deck allow for a flexible and strategic approach to control the game and outvalue the opponent.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage engines. With a focus on managing the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy, the deck aims to establish dominance over the game through powerful late-game plays and versatile threats. By generating value through card draw, ramp, and versatile modal cards, the deck seeks to outlast the opponent and eventually overwhelm them with powerful spells and creatures.

This deck focuses on utilizing a variety of control spells and removal to outlast the opponent and control the board state. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value through blinking permanents. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Emergent Ultimatum and Alrund's Epiphany to secure victory. By managing threats with removal spells and card advantage, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and win through attrition. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the three-color combination of black, green, and blue.

This deck focuses on controlling the board and out-valuing the opponent through a combination of removal spells, card advantage engines, and powerful threats. By utilizing cards like Emergent Ultimatum, Extinction Event, and Heartless Act, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating incremental advantages. With Yorion as a companion, the deck is able to consistently draw extra cards and protect its threats with blink effects. The mana base is carefully curated to ensure the deck can cast its spells on curve and maximize its powerful color combination.

This Temur Aggro deck focuses on generating value through card advantage and efficient threats. It utilizes powerful cards like Goldspan Dragon and The Great Henge to generate mana and draw cards, while also including disruptive spells like Mystical Dispute and Disdainful Stroke to control the opponent's plays. The deck aims to quickly establish a board presence with creatures like Brazen Borrower and Lovestruck Beast, then finish off the opponent with big threats like Embercleave and Elder Gargaroth. With a mix of efficient creatures, removal spells, and card advantage engines, this deck looks to overwhelm opponents with its aggressive gameplay.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures such as Elder Gargaroth, Goldspan Dragon, Bonecrusher Giant, and Lovestruck Beast to pressure the opponent and win the game as quickly as possible. The inclusion of cards like The Great Henge and Edgewall Innkeeper helps maintain card advantage and provide additional value. Additionally, the deck uses a mix of powerful spells like Spikefield Hazard, Mystical Dispute, and Purphoros's Intervention to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures and efficient spellcasting.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly develop a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent through aggressive creatures like Kazandu Mammoth, Goldspan Dragon, and Bonecrusher Giant. The deck also includes cards like Brazen Borrower and Lovestruck Beast for additional tempo plays. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion adds an extra twist to the deck, providing a unique strategy to enhance the overall damage output. The deck runs a versatile spell package to disrupt opponents' plays and maintain control of the game while maximizing damage potential.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Kazandu Mammoth, Bonecrusher Giant, and Goldspan Dragon to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion enhances the deck's damage potential. The Great Henge provides card draw and life gain, while Brazen Borrower and Lovestruck Beast offer versatility and board control. The deck also includes counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Saw It Coming for protection. The mana base is optimized for consistency and versatility, allowing for smooth gameplay and powerful tempo swings.

Utilizing the ability of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion, the deck focuses on maximizing damage output with odd converted mana cost creatures. The deck includes powerful creatures like Elder Gargaroth and Goldspan Dragon to apply pressure, supported by disruptive spells like Brazen Borrower and counter magic like Mystical Dispute. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge to maintain momentum. The mana base is designed to consistently cast the deck's spells while providing different colors of mana for flexibility.

The deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient spells. By utilizing powerful creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Goldspan Dragon, along with disruptive elements like Brazen Borrower and counter spells, the deck aims to control the board and deal damage quickly. The inclusion of Obosh as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency and damage potential to the deck. With a strong mana base and a mix of threats and answers, the deck can adapt to different situations and maintain a fast pace throughout the game.

The deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy using creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Kazandu Mammoth, and Lovestruck Beast to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The goal is to establish a strong board presence early on and use cards like The Great Henge and Elder Gargaroth to maintain momentum and draw additional cards. Additionally, the inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion adds a unique twist to the deck by doubling the damage output of odd-cost cards. The deck also includes some tempo spells like Brazen Borrower and counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Saw It Coming for protection.

This deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures and using them to pressure the opponent's life total. The key strategy is to curve out efficiently with creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Lovestruck Beast, while also generating value with cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge. Obosh, the Preypiercer acts as a powerful companion that amplifies the deck's damage output. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Mystical Dispute and Saw It Coming to control the opponent's game plan. Overall, the Temur Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient creature-based strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to use efficient creatures like Lovestruck Beast, Bonecrusher Giant, and Goldspan Dragon to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Mystical Dispute and Saw It Coming to control the board and protect its creatures. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion adds an extra layer of aggression and damage potential. The mana base consists of pathways and triomes to ensure consistency in casting spells of all colors. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and powerful aggro strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures and efficient spells. By utilizing cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Lovestruck Beast to draw cards and generate tokens, combined with removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Brazen Borrower, the deck aims to control the board while applying pressure. Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast is used to cheat out powerful creatures like Koma, Cosmos Serpent, and Esika's Chariot to further solidify its advantage. The deck is designed to be proactive and aggressive, aiming to close out games quickly.

This Temur Aggro deck focuses on playing creatures quickly and efficiently to put pressure on the opponent. With a mix of powerful creatures like Koma, Cosmos Serpent and Bonecrusher Giant, supported by card draw from Llanowar Visionary and Edgewall Innkeeper, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. The deck also includes some control elements like counterspells to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast provides a powerful way to cheat out big threats from the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of efficient creatures and removal spells to apply pressure on the opponent early in the game. By curving out with powerful creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Bonecrusher Giant, backed up by cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast, the deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of counter spells like Mystical Dispute and Negate helps protect the deck's threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also utilizing card advantage engines like Llanowar Visionary and Brazen Borrower to maintain momentum.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells while generating card advantage through the use of Edgewall Innkeeper and Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain a strong board presence to quickly close out the game. Cards like Lovestruck Beast and Bonecrusher Giant help to establish a dominant board while Koma, Cosmos Serpent provides a powerful late-game threat. The inclusion of counterspells like Miscast, Mystical Dispute, Negate, and Disdainful Stroke helps to protect the deck's game plan and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and applying pressure on the opponent through aggressive plays and powerful creatures. The combination of efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Lovestruck Beast, along with card advantage engines like Edgewall Innkeeper, allows the deck to maintain momentum and overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast acts as a strong finisher by cheating out high-impact threats like Koma, Cosmos Serpent. The deck also includes a small suite of removal spells and counterspells to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan.
